section.title: API
section.para: There is two methods of DBCleanerService:

row.entry: If workspace is multiDB - drops JCR_SITEM,JCR_SVALUE, JCR_SREF tables, otherwise, it removes all rows of this workspace.
Removes data of all worksapces of this repository.

section.title: How it works
section.para: removeWorkspaceData takes workspaces configs from RepositoryEntry and clean each workspace using removeRepositoryData.

section.title: Scripts in detail
section.para: Single and Multi DB scripts examples
In case of: dbDialect = "MySQL" and isMultiDB="true", will use "conf/storage/cleanup/jcr-mjdbc.mysql.sql"
In case of: dbDialect = "PgSQL" and isMultiDB="false", will use "conf/storage/cleanup/jcr-sjdbc.pgsql.sql"

note.para: "?" will be replased with container name on execution.

section.para: But what is the strage coment is in "conf/storage/cleanup/jcr-sjdbc.sql" ?

/*$CLEAN_JCR_SITEM_DEFAULT*/ - some database may throw constraint violaion exception according to JCR_FK_SITEM_PARENT FOREIGN KEY in case of ordinary "" delete from JCR_SITEM where CONTAINER_NAME=? query. So there is special method, that will be executed on /*$CLEAN_JCR_SITEM_DEFAULT*/. It a bit slowly, but safe.

note.para: "conf/storage/cleanup/jcr-sjdbc.sql" or "conf/storage/cleanup/jcr-mjdbc.sql" are used if dialect is not recognized.

listitem.para: DBCleanerService is static, so all you need is config to execute;
code that executes DBCleanerService must have JCRRuntimePermissions.MANAGE_REPOSITORY_PERMISSION;
you can update scripts for your needs.
